scenarioDescription:
The WASP-158 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-158 is a star with 1.38 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.39 times its radius. It is located 1712.30 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.93 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WASP-158 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-158 system


WASP-158 b

WASP-158 b was discovered by the SuperWASP-South observatory, in 2019-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-158 b is 887.220 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-158 b is 11.994 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-158 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-158, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the SuperWASP-South.
name: WASP-158 - System With 1 Exoplanet
